questions.question: Which famous battle site in North America is known for a pivotal 1863 conflict during the American Civil War?
questions.context: This site was the turning point in the Civil War and features the largest military burials in the United States, with President Lincoln's famous address delivered here.

questions.question: This marvel of modern architecture in Asia held the title of the world's tallest building from 1998 to 2004. What is its name?
questions.context: These twin skyscrapers symbolized Malaysia's emergence as an economic power and featured in the film 'Entrapment'.

questions.question: What ancient ruin in the present-day Middle East is known for its impressive rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, once a thriving caravan city?
questions.context: This site, also a UNESCO World Heritage Site, was the center of a caravan trade and recently featured in the film 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade'.

questions.question: One of the museums in South America, named after a famous artist, holds the largest collection of his works. Which museum is this?
questions.context: This museum displays the works of Fernando Botero known for his signature style depicting people and figures in large, exaggerated volume.

questions.question: Which dark tourism site in Asia commemorates the tragic atomic bombing during World War II and aims to promote peace?

answer.label: Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park, Hiroshima, Japan

questions.context: Located near the epicenter of the 1945 atomic explosion, this site displays the devastation's aftermath and seeks to educate on nuclear disarmament.
